Dicky looked at two or three pairs of lovers outside the window, with no waves in his heart.
He lowered his head, picked up the ball pen and continued to write Qidong homework.
The green plastic desktop was sprinkled with golden blocks by the sun, dividing his hands and paper. The electric fan whirred and the air conditioner sent out a cool breath.
No one came to pat him on the shoulder and chat with him. He was just an ordinary middle school student, even a little ugly, and his grades had not improved except English and Chinese.
He didn’t care about these feelings. He did his homework everyday and spent a lot of time at home, so he lived a dull life.
Until he met a girl.
Her name was YuChen. She was the first in class 11. Her short hair could not cover her jaw well. Her pink glasses and smiling narrowed eyes made Dicky feel excited, as if she had put on filters, which was so unprecedented.
Clumsy as he was, he did not know how to express his flood of emotions.
He wrote many love letters in English and was teased by his classmates several times. After writing, he had some doubts at first, and then he threw them into the school garbage can one by one. The paper rubbed together, as if he did not know how to place it.
At the end, he slowly became a little confident and gave the first letter.
Only one sentence came back: “What do you like about me? Can’t I change it?”
He was very happy. The note was filled with sentences, “like your student number”, “like your name” and “like your school uniform”···
Finally, “I like everything about you” was in the middle, in big bold, and he described it several times.
His love for her could drown any high-rise building in the world, and the electric wire connected to his heart could keep the electric fan running 24 hours a day. The previously practiced words bloomed in the pen, and the skimming hooks were so astringent.
“Honey,” he wrote in the school blogs, “I heard that you have got chickenpox. Is it serious?”
“It’s wonderful to see her cut her hair (change his line), in the barber shop last week.”
Everyone began to laugh at him, saying that he was infatuated, did not know how to chase people, and chased too closely.
Dicky still wrote Qidong homework every day, but would sigh inexplicably at the little couple when looking out of the window.
One day, he wrote love letters too late, and fell asleep in bed before he had time to do his homework. The next day he did not hand in his homework, and the teacher did not look for him. After going to the bathroom, he walked into the classroom and saw a pile of rolled test sheets and uncorrected exercise books on his seat. He sat in, took out a barely blank paper from it, and began to write love letters again. It seemed that such days had lasted for a long time, and he thought it was good.
His back-desk-mate asked him which university he wanted to go to.
“Tsinghua.” He casually replied which was a habit he had recently formed.
The back-desk-mate showed him a piece of paper, which seemed to be secretly typed. It was full of foreign universities, and he only knew that there was a Harvard in it.

They made a deal. In the evening, when Dicky was watching school blogs like he used to when he was bored, he saw his back-desk-mate had changed his avatar, which was the school logo of MIT he saw today. He then changed his original man with a heart into the logo of Stanford. He still remembered that it was a red tree.
He began to study hard. The teachers were all happy and said that he was beginning to do hardwork. The Chinese teacher sat at the table and took a sip of hot tea and said, “This man is trying to force himself. It’s useless for anyone to force him suddenly.”
He got the top 10 in Chinese, the top 20 in mathematics and the top 5 in English. His back table was even harder, who made a sudden progress of 100 forward.
Then, two weeks later, he and three other boys in the class secretly ran out of the classroom in the evening self-study and wandered around the teaching building. He saw YuChen at the back door of class 11. He only felt his heart wrenched and a little hyperemic joy.
“Why don’t you study?” That day, when his front-desk-mate went out to take out the garbage, she saw him leaning up on the railing, half asking and half talking to herself.
“I don’t want to learn.” He looked at her. “It’s boring.”
The front-desk-mate nodded and went back to work to pack her schoolbag.
In class, he sighed again.
“What are you sighing for?! Young people, sighing every day, as if they were war-torn old men. People of your age, it’s not time to sigh!” The Chinese teacher put down the 53 homework in his hand.
“Dicky, really please don’t sigh. You are making the classroom inactive.” The English teacher also stopped turning over the courseware on her hand and seemed to be sighing silently.
The math teacher just smiled with his classmates every time Dicky sighed. She only stared angrily in private and asked him to do his homework well.
He continued his life. Almost every day, he would send sad copies in the school blogs, most of which were written by himself. He also liked to add a rose at the end and adjust the font to a dreamy purple and pink.
He had long stopped chasing YuChen. He tried to chase his front-desk-mate, but then he did not think it was interesting and stopped chasing. He had some good feelings for almost every girl, and had also engaged in online love. Every love was true, but it could never last long.
In class, he would look out of the window. There had been no lovers outside for a long time, but he just liked to look outside, as if he could see the wind and the classroom of class 11 far away.
Looking in the mirror, he would confidently sigh “I’m so handsome”. After the grades came out, he would complain about his waste to his back-desk-mate, and watched the school blogs again in less than three minutes.
He would say hello to the new month, sent encouraging words to motivate himself, and sent lies that he did not believe in love.
Life went on like this. Even on weekends and near the high school entrance examination, he liked to go out with the other three boys and walked on the smoky snack street. He did not like to eat too much, so he would walk for a long time or run at night.
Later, they all graduated, which seemed to be a long time ago, and it seemed to have nothing to do with him.
At this time, Dicky no longer had the green plastic table, nor blue Qidong homework. His past was abandoned in love letters thrown into garbage cans, mixed with his blood, which disturbed his life like clear water. His feathers were plump, hot and sad.

entry.title: The Meaning of Living
entry.content:
The Meaning of Living

Slytherin

He argued around on the ground floor. In the common room stood the four Hogwart’s founders and sometimes some other characters from other buildings came nearby to take part in the discussion.
Salazar Slytherin was making a speech, based on my terrible life.
Yes, my terrible life.
In addition, my unclear future and messy time schedule had made my mind palace turned into pessimist mode.
“Please, there’s no meaning in living! Everyone knows that.” He chattered. The air was filled with pungent freshness, and the night had already crawled in.
“No, no, living…is having a meaning!” Someone who Slytherin thought was called Simon Cleary said, pouring a pint of beer into his mouth.
Salazar Slytherin didn’t want to argue with him.
“Life is meaningless. We are just small dust in the universe, and what we are doing, has nothing to do with the universe. The universe itself doesn’t have life, no autonomous consciousness. It just keeps breeding. If life is a practice, the end of practice is death anyway. Then why do you have to suffer so much? There are so many things to worry about every day. Isn’t direct death a direct liberation? Life has no meaning. We abandon everything to give it meanings, which is nothingness. Because it has no meaning at all, it is how it comes and goes, and the final outcome is death. Whether you do evil or do good in your life, it is nothing more than the different evaluation of the world. In a few years, no one will remember who you are. In the end, you are just a piece of the vast tombstone. Happiness is brief, sadness is enduring…”
“Emm are you sure we are going to talk about these discouraging remarks? I mean, it’s also meaningless to talk about this, I mean, even if you realise you’re the only person who realise life is meaningless, what can you do about it?” Logic pointed out.
“Actually, I’ve already made a plan about how we can suicide elegantly and mysteriously.” Godric Gryffindor waved his hand.

Gryffindor

Godric Gryffindor thought the plan was perfect, at least to him.
They would first make it to eighteen, the perfect age which I turned into an adult in law. Then at that time, they would discuss again about whether I should suicide. Because everyone knew that not until I turned into an adult who had capacity of stable thinking, all of them shouldn’t make any big decision because it’s definitely not mature.
Then, Gryffindor believed, if they still agreed on suiciding, his plan would help a lot.
He would first book a ticket to Bermuda. Seeing the Bermuda Triangle, just to know where they would be dying. Then he would be spending the money on travelling around the world, because there’re some really good friends in different countries they want to see. Mostly friends made online.
In the end, they would learn how to ride a boat. They would buy a boat, and row it into the Bermuda Triangle with “scientific reasons”. At that time, they would fall into a black hole, or just die in the sea.
If they fell into a black hole, then that’s great, they get to experience new stuff. And if they died, there’s no cost for themselves because they’re already a dead body. Not to mention whether they would exist after I died.
This was a perfect way to suicide. Dying in the ocean with all the sea creatures and people would be explaining the matter to my relatives and friends like:”It was an accident.”.
“You do realise that you’re getting Slytherin in the way of thinking right?” Rowena Ravenclaw muttered.
“But this is just a thought after all. We are not going to do it right away, we are just thinking it seriously. There’s a lot of preconditions to consider about before we take actions.” Salazar Slytherin tapped Logic on the shoulder.
“I can already hear people telling you this is nonsense when you say this to them.” Politician said, “Maybe they will laugh.”
“I still agree on myself. We should definitely experience killing ourselves before drowning into the sea.” Cheerilee said.
“Geeze, we can talk about this when she turned 18, but not now okay? Everything we are saying now is pointless because we are not mature characters yet! And she’s only an adolesent!” a male Hufflepuff moarned.
Everyone shut, excepted Gryffindor.
The discussion was over.

Wen

Wen was still thinking about the meaning of life.
In the reporting hall, sunshine glittered. Ming walked in, saying:”Still thinking about the meaning of life?”
Wen only nodded.
The broadcasting room started to ring. People quickly realised that it was my friend calling me, and rushed into the room to hear the conversation.
It was from my best friend July, so nobody left the room.
Then Wen suddenly realised the meaning of life.
Then she realised she realised the meaning of living.
It was that there was no meaning in myself living. Because I could not take the responsibility of my life. I could not be responsible for myself. When I died, nobody care, nobody know.
I could always sink into the Ideological imprisonment I built for myself. If I wanted, even if I was a failure I could still feel good about myself. If I wanted, I could give up everything, fames and money, and even life. Because nobody was taking control of my life, I could do whatever I want.
But, Wen thought about July.
She thought about Ming, and all those characters just like her.
She thought, maybe the meaning of living wasn’t in myself. Maybe it’s in, that I need to take responsibility in others who loved me.
If I couldn’t get into a good university and get a good job, I may couldn’t get a glamorous future to my beloved ones. I could be failing every day, but she couldn’t imagine the impacts it would have on others.
“That’s a good emotional point.” Ravenclaw said.
“Are we being both self-confident and normal?” Logic asked.
“You know when others depressed you, you would become critical once you think in this way right?” Quirinus Quirrell confirmed.
“Why you take responsibility of others? Others have nothing to do with you.” The Dark Side.
“Turns out we have fallen into the ideological imprisonment we built for ourselves in the end.” Ravenclaw sighed.
“I thought we’ve finally figured it out.” Wen said innocently.
“This is driving me crazy.” Ming stated.

Politician

There’s no meaning in life, according to Salazar Slytherin. And there’s a perfect plan to suicide, according to Godric Gryffindor. And there’s also a good reason for living which is based on self-moving, according to Wen.
Politician decided there’s no reason in living but we still need to live on.
“Why?“ Slytherin roared.
“No why. It’s just that we don’t have proper reasons for thinking this philosophical ‘meaning of living’, because as Logic said, we can do nothing about it at the moment.”
“Besides, we don’t have the ability to think up an answer to it yet.” Logic pointed out.
“So, after all this time, we don’t have a conclusion?” Ravenclaw.
“No.” Hufflepuff.
“Shouldn’t we be saying some soul soother thing just to end our meeting?” Michael recommended.
“That would be lying.” Slytherin grinned.
“My conclusion is, we should put this aside, and move on to our life. Just like others do.” Politician said.
There was Alice’s Doctor Bungy arguing “avoiding is just leaving matters to tomorrow” but Slytherin got some people to get his mouth shut.
And then I started working again.

The End.
entry.summary: My conclusion is, we should put this aside, and move on to our life. Just like others do.

entry.title: Why art and music therapy should be covered by health insurance
entry.content:
Imagine yourself in a room with relaxing music playing. You have a piece of paper and many pens, you draw lines, color blocks, something figurative, or objects that are so abstract that you yourself cannot even recognize fully. It may look like a dog or a leaf. What it looks like is actually unimportant, in fact, what you are drawing is unimportant too. When the nib scratches the paper, following an expected or unexpected path, your brain is relaxed… This small action smooths your brain, freeing yourself from a terrible day or even a hard life. And that, is art and music therapy.

In the Journal of The Art of Psychotherapy published in February 2018, a study looked at around 200 patients hospitalized for medical problems or surgery. Researchers found that attending art therapy for 50 minutes significantly improved their mood and reduced their pain and anxiety levels.

Thus, the benefits of art and music therapy are clear. As art and music have a deep connection to our souls, this method is considered to be advanced, giving people the necessary assistance.

Now the question arises: Why do we need art and music therapy? The therapy has been used for treating teenagers in recent years. The results turned out to be satisfying, promoting wellness and aiding psychological rehabilitation. They have also been proved to help students with no mental problems cope better, both physically and psychologically. Furthermore, art and music do not only assist juveniles. It also helps children and adults to develop communication skills and motivation for learning new tasks.

Now some may ask: “Why would insurance companies be willing to cover the expenses of this type of therapy?” I believe art and music therapy prevents mental illness from worsening. If spiritual problems were solved in advance with art therapy, it would save more money for insurance companies than if there was a serious problem. This is equivalent to reducing the probability of serious illnesses, hence the amount of compensation paid by the insurance company would decrease significantly.

To sum it all up, a challenge we are all facing right now is to prevent as much mental health problems as possible. Due to the huge amount of pressure and stress caused by school and parents, many people my age suffer from severe depression and anxiety. It is heartbreaking to see young students go as far as committing suicide because they cannot get the help they need. We need to do something before it is too late. We need to stop neglecting to our mental health. We need to make full use of art and music therapy. In order to help not only my peers, but also all those who need such help, I think it is important to obtain financial support for art and music therapy from insurance companies.

entry.title: Omake 1
entry.content:
So, where was I?

Right.

Michael: Hey you should really check this out.
Ravenclaw: Why looking at me?
Jiao: You know, about the fact that she has this kind of mental disorder, everyone of us has a responsibility.
Cheerilee: Quite agree.
Hufflepuff: This is not a test…
Slytherin: This is not a test.

Since I was in secondary school, I have been having a weird world going on in my head.
Every character I know, is inside my head. The first time it happened was when I was at my edge doing Maths problem. Slytherin and Ravenclaw whispered besides my head, having quarrels. That did no good to me, and I failed that test at that particular last question.
At first it was only Slytherin and Ravenclaw, from Harry Potter. Then there were Gryffindor and Hufflepuff, sometimes two or three Ravenclaws will have debates, from time to time Hufflepuff points out my mistakes on common sense.
My Logic and Politician appeared as my origin characters. There are also characters from real life, people from all over the world.
But this is only the first stage.

I have never tried to abandon them. I have read too many stories, where the heroes will not embrace their gifts or weakness, but only manage to accept them when it is all too late.
So first it was only voices. Then one day, I laid down on my bed, and these voices started to have visions.
Or maybe it was just my imagination, since anything could happen for a eleven-year-old.
I did think I saw milky ghosts. They were besides my body perpendicularly, still chattering away excitedly.
The next day when I woke up, character after character started to have their own bodies. Ravenclaw was a woman with feather wings on her back, and Slytherin had only snake tail for the down half of his body. And it turned out that my Logic was a mermaid living in a cube tank.
Now you are probably laughing now, and decide to sniff at the rest of the post. “Aha, it turns out everyone has their own imaginary little world, I have my Maths teacher yelling inside my head when I’m doing Maths too. Can’t believe this child thought she was unique.” is what you think. However, these things I said did happen truly. I did not control my mind to imagine I have a bunch of characters, but, I perdict, it is my mind doing something really weird. They can not stop talking when I ask them to, and they say things that often are out of my expectations.
I drew my characters on a notebook I had at that time, a notebook which I used as my Chinese extra-lecture notes. I am still keeping that book, some of the drawings have random dialogues they said besides their pictures, along with the motions they had and looks on their face.
So this is the second stage.

Sherlock Holmes, has a mind palace.
Rigel Black, has a mind barrier used to avoid Legilimency.
Sherlock Holmes is from the BBC Sherlock, while Rigel Black is a main character in The Rigel Black Chronicles.
These two all described detailed mind building, which inspired me much at that time. It was also when I realized that my characters were standing in nowhere air.
I decided to give mind palace a shot. Before my mind itself builds anything weird. However, the mind palace was not exactly what I was looking for. In fact, accomodations were made in my head for my residents.
A golden desert. A normal three floor black house in the middle of the sand sea. Down in the dungeon, is where the real world belongs. There is a password, and then there is eight doors. The correct door leads to the continent, where a yellow field appears, leading to a village. Into the village, and that is finally where I can find my characters.
It made my life becomes easier. When I need them, I will just go to the character’s living place, without disturbing the noisy others. They become quiter too, as they started to construct and decorate their own areas. Although Ravenclaw argued that the rate of my making dumb decisions will increase if I was without them (it turned out to be true afterwards), Cheerilee quite enjoyed her endless tea time and Rainbow Dash was delighted to have his own factory.
A “mind palace” also increased my characters amount, making them more comprehensive, and provided me a space to imagine and perdict things more detailed.
This is where the third stage ends.

So what do they do?
They provide different views on my problems and actions, giving me the most all-round advantages and disadvantages they can offer. The Economicsts are always rational, and give me solutions with maximized profit.
They also helped me with my study, especially Ravenclaw, who is always willing to schedule my study plan.
My fiction writing has received great help from them too.
There are many other things they help me with, while they also bring many troubles at the same time. For example, once I was considered to be a maniac when one of my classmates saw me blaming a mass of air. Sometimes, they slow down process.

And this is all about my mental disorder, which does not have much use but always crazy to hear when I try to explain it to others. Actually, I have never told anyone about this whole thing before.
I guess I will put it in the “Rationality” category, as my characters’ greatest function is to help my practical decisions making. This is also an introduction to my muses, in case they play roles in my other random thinking posts while readers can not understand why a mermaid suddenly appears in the half of an Economic article.
entry.summary: An Omake. And I do not have adolescent delusions.
